La Jolla Cove.name: La Jolla Cove
reviews: Parking is a disaster, but walking the area was delightful. Visited just before sunset. A must see during a San Diego visit.

My daughter and I booked a snorkeling trip with San Diego Snorkeling & Scuba. The tour lasted about 90 minutes. The instructor/guide, Phil was terrific and the equipment first class. Although the weather had been colder than normal and water choppy, the thick wetsuits really insulated us and getting to swim into the caves was a terrific experience. It is clearly not the Caribbean or Hawaii for snorkeling, but it was a wonderful experience and we enjoyed the views before and after with a walk around La Jolla. Parking in the area gets especially challenging on weekends.
Show less
Easy Stroll with Look Outs and Sea Lions

The cove is a nice stroll. The path meanders along the bluff edge. There's not much parking so I'd walk down from Prospect Street. There are a few stairs down the beach. Depending on the time of year, they may be closed for sea lion calfing season. That was the case when we were there. But, rather than access to a small plot of sand, you'll get to see the sea lions basking in the sun.
Show less
A Must See in San Diego

Prior to visiting we had read very little on La Jolla Cove. We went hoping for the best and were not disappointed. This is a must see for everyone when visiting San Diego. Parking is difficult to find but do not give up. The cove is beautiful and the rocks and cliffs are great. We went on the beach with the seals and got up close views of them and their pups. Great experience!
Show less
This is one of my favorite beaches in the world. I always feel inner peace restored when I come back to this coast. Truly transformative happy, healthy and holy cove.

We heard about La Jolla cove and finally paid a visit. We didn’t know it was pupping season so we were pleasantly surprised to see all the harbor seals with their pups on the beach. A short walk further up the cove and you can get closer to the seals but respect the wildlife and keep a safe distance. La Jolla is a very short beautiful drive from San Diego and we plan on staying here or in nearby Pacific Beach on our next trip.
Show less
We stayed in La Jolla and walked down to the cove each day. It's beautiful. After seeing both San Diego and La Jolla, I would say skip it and just go to La Jolla.
Great place to watch the various animals
The sea lions were all sunning, and the cormorants were nesting when we stopped there. It's just a cool place to stop for awhile.
A neat place to view these animals, but know that it gets crowded quickly and finding parking can be a challenge. Getting there early is recommended. Also, lots of shops and restaurants to enjoy,
It was a very windy day but with clear blue skies, with the sun shining. lots of people as well. lovely and gorgeous views

It was nice to see the seals. They are plentiful. There are beautiful waves and scenic photo ops. There's nice places to lay out and picnic or just read. It was smelly down there though. There were many people in the water even though it was very cool out. I guess it depends on how you feel about cold water but I prefer warmer water.
Show less

If you are going to La Jolla definitely stop by and go to the La Jolla Cove (inside a shop so look for the sign). It's a bit steep (no it is steep), narrow, and wet. Best to have sneakers or sandals with no slip. Pretty cool when you get down the stairs! Then take a walk on the bluffs and go down to the beach (lots of sea lions). Great eats too! This is another reason we love California! It's not just a place for tourists.
Show less

Ahh La Jolla what a beautiful place to have the good fortune to visit especially on ideal sun shining blue sky Southern California Day. We strolled along and of course went down to the cove to get a closer view of the sea lions. Interesting and fun to watch but be warned .... try to stay upwind.


The grounds of the park areas are beautiful and very well cared for. Very inviting to picnic , laze in the sun or just drink in the ambiance.

We had taken a picnic lunch , found an open bench and enjoyed our lunch while looking out to sea. Very nice.
Show less

Wow such a sweet towns
So much to see and do Jolla cove was nice but really outdated
Stay away from room 416
Right below the breakfast room
The noise starts at 555 am when the staff comes into get breakfast ready!!other than that it was pretty nice

Show less

We walked from Bahia Hotel to LaJolla which was about an 8 mile walk, beautiful all the way! They have both oceanside walk and bay walk with beautiful flowers all the way! The cove was so interesting and we ate at George's above the cove then stopping to see the seals at George's cove. Fun!
Show less

This location is a must visit as it’s good for everyone with the outstanding views, seals, shops, food and the long stair walk to the sea cave. There’s also swimming in the warmer months, but we visited in Feb so the water temps were a little cool.
Show less
Excellent place to see seals upclose

We visited here in February and it was amazing to get up close to the seals and watch the sunset with them. Some people were getting way too close.. if they bark at you then back up. However they started getting closer and closer to some people. They're very sweet and protective of their young. Respect them and enjoy the sunset together
Show less
A must see place. Lovely views and nice place to chill out. Lots of wildlife to see and when we visited there were lots of seal pups.

The waves, rocks, ocean, everything was stunning to see. There were dozens of sea lions and seals lounging around, and they created the most awful smell. We had to drive around for parking for 20 minutes before finally going for the 10$/hour parking offered by a business across the street. We stayed for less than an hour. We took some amazing pictures, but could not stay long due to the overpowering odor.
Show less
Make sure you take time to see the cove and walk around the park. With every turn, the views get better.

This area is so lovely, and the seals are amazing. I don't understand why visitors insist on going down on the beach when mothers have just given birth to their babies. What the heck is up with that? STAY AWAY and do not disturb the mothers..you can look from up top.
Show less

Very crowded with humans, but fascinating wildlife. Pelicans and Brandt's cormorants nesting on the cliffs, and a huge colony of "fragrant" sea lions barking loudly on the rocks will entertain young and old alike. Walk down the paved path to the Children's beach at low tide to see many mother seals and pups resting on the sand.
Show less
Pretty views, with the cliffs and sea lions. Walking paths from sidewalk to dirt paths up through the hills. Great scenic views.
Amazing to see the Sea Lions taking over the rocks and beach area. Photo ops were just perfect even with some fog.

I’m so happy we went to La Jolla Cove. My day was truly made watching the sea lions. It didn’t smell as bad as some others had mentioned. I think it was a general beach like smell. Wear comfy shoes and a jacket. It can get windy and cold.
Show less

This has to be one of the most beautiful coast lines I have seen. The views driving to La Jolla cove are amazing and when you get there it’s absolutely beautiful. The sea lions were a surprise. Parking is easy just be patient. It could get really crowded.
Show less
What a beautiful experience. The seals and sea lions are adorable and the views are amazing. Definitely stay till sunset. There are some cool shops and restaurants near by also.
Low tide is better but Seals are there most times. Low tide you can walk through the caves but fantastic experience with natural wildlife
Definitely worth a stop if you are not too far away

I looked up things to do in La Jolla since we were staying there for the long holiday weekend, and I came across this. Glad we went. Those sea lions/seals are worth the view. I did not see the area where they were all laying out immediately, so I climbed on all of these rocks to get close to the island in my pictures. Don't do that! If you walk a little farther down you will see an area that is really easy to get to and see the sea lions. Those rocks were very slippery and I fell.
Show less
Very fun place to visit. As others have said. it's too had people can't give the wildlife their space....

A lovely little sheltered sandy beach where we spent an hour or so splashing in the sea with our two year old. Much fun was had by us all. A very clean beach with water fountain and toilets very nearby.

Parking was a time consuming endeavor but the snorkeling was worth it. Snorkeled from the cove and around through the caves. Not the easiest place for learning to snorkel as the water was very choppy but it was a lot of fun. It was a bit difficult to navigate all the kayakers and not everyone in the water seemed to be paying attention to their surroundings. The smell from the sea lions is pretty unbearable but I got used to it after a while.
Show less

My husband and I visited La Jolla Cove while were in the San Diego area. We were glad we did! It's a beautiful area! We were able to get up close to the sea lions (beware: they're quite stinky), which was really cool! After exploring the beach, we walked a short distance to Girard Avenue and Prospect Street for dinner and a little shopping. It was a great way to spend an evening.
Show less
Nice to bring out of towners

This is the type of locations you bring visitors from out of town. Feel bad for those that live near. They are better beaches in La Jolla depending of your personal needs (surf, swim, or getting sun).
A must see in San Diego

By just walking short distances, you can get different dramatic views of the Pacific as it strikes the rugged coastline. Both kids and adults will want to observe the seals as they bask in a small beach area. The feel of the fresh salt air I find to be quite refreshing. I visit the sight periodically and will definitely do so again. Oh, and it's free.
Show less
Must see for the coat walk and views.
So glad we made the trip to go and see the beauty that is La Jolla. Fun stores and wildlife in the area.

I has a wonderful time here always wanted to visit. I was mesmerized by the seals and has great photo ops. I did however let my guard down and I was so busy focusing on taking pics that I slipped on slime I dislocated my knee. I was miserable the rest of my vacation:/
I warn you please watch were you step. Wear good shoes. I know it’s common sense, but it’s so magical it’s easy to forget. Honestly totally worth it. I would love to come back.
Show less
Great beach to walk along and see sea lions

We had time to kill before our flight home and we are so glad we came here. What a gem! Many benches to sit along the paved walkway along the water. You can hear sea lions and watch them swim and lay in the sun. They are quite an attraction. There are a few who braved the cold water.
Show less
A bit windy, but beautiful. We visited during our college visit at UC San Diego. Peaceful and entertaining to see gliders going by.
This is a beautiful place to visit.
I enjoy the beach and La Jolla Cove is beautiful and relaxing. Smaller and more quaint then the big beaches of California but so worth going to.

Having grown up in Southern California, La Jolla is a favorite of our family. Unfortunately, because it's well known, there are far too many people there who don't respect the sea lions who sun on the rocks. It's difficult to get a picture without people everywhere, but if you can, it's beautiful.
Show less
A must when visiting La Jolla.
The entire shore area of La Jolla is fantastic and walkable. La Jolla Cove is a bit more calm for divers and water sports. Loved seeing the sea lions and birds.
Super nice beach to spend your day
It was a very fun day spent at la joya cove walking around this beautiful area, watching the sea lions and enjoying the views of the nice houses around and the sea.
Love this area for the water and wildlife. Feels powerful and safe. Girls loved it and was easy to be around.

Spectacular is an understatement. So much to see and do here. You can get close to Seal Lions and Seals, watch SCUBA divers, look at birds, swim, fish and the scenery is breath taking. This is a must see!

We walked all along the shore in La Jolla. The cove was busy both times we visited from above, but we didn't venture down. There were sea lions on the rocks and people were getting fairly close. Along the beach people were wading, swimming and snorkeling with sea lions swimming around too. Along the upper rocks were many cormorants nesting. Farther to the north a little were a number of kayaks.
It was quite fishy smelling, not sure I would get in the water right there.
Show less
It has big waves, seals, and body surfers. On a Sunday there are outdoor concerts and lots of interesting people.It is a must visit for out of town people. Come early as parking is tough.
Had a great time...it's so beautiful there windy and cold around this time.. Will come back during summer... PARKING is hard but just wait until someone gets out...worth the wait..

I went here with a friend and her kids which were 2 and 3 years old. They lived this as much as we did! The Sea lions just lounge around everywhere and you can get pretty close. The kids loved listening to them bark and play with each other. I'm so glad we stopped! Absolutely amazing.
Show less

Wow, do not miss a visit to La Jolla Cove. What a place, we saw seals, sea lions, squirrels, pelicans and many other types of bird. Walking close to the sea lions was like being part of the zoo, not watching from behind glass but up close and personal. A bit wiffy but we'll worth it. Stunningly beautiful and free parking- you can't ask for anything else.
Show less
Sunday Brunch and walk along beach
Intended to go to Cody’s but the wait was about an hour. We ate next door at olive and basil. The ocean walk was great. Lots of shops etc in this beautiful area.

I have been traveling to San Diego for 30 plus years and always make time to visit La Jolla Cove. You can relax on the beach, family can go shopping and my favorite is kayaking and snorkeling with family and friends.
So beautiful here, but picked a week day on this trip to avoid the crowds of people who can spoil nature at it's finest.
Beautiful location, go early to get parking.
Beautiful location. Lots of people and parking was a little tough to find but be patient and something will open up or park a ways up the street. Lots of seals to see.
So many beautiful things to see! The seals and sea lions are adorable, the homes are spectacular and the shops and restaurants are all so quaint and friendly.
Loved it there. The seals and sea lions were so cool to see. The ocean is breathtaking. Views are spectacular.
Sight to see while you're there

It's definitely an interesting spot to visit while you're in the area. There are tons of seals you can see and take photos of (just don't touch them, I think its illegal, plus wildlife should be left alone). This area is BEAUTIFUL during sunset :)

We attempted to go to the cove to see the seals but finding a parking spot was impossible. I dropped my friends off to go see the seals, tried to find parking and then gave up. We parked in the 3 minute passenger pickup spot and I ran to find my friends while my husband stayed in the car. The stench was quite overwhelming to me, I took a quick pic of the seals and ran back to the car. Tried to go to the restroom but it was too nasty so I passed.
Recommend going early to get parking...then it might be fun. We went at 11am on a Saturday in February and it was nuts.
Show less
Its Easy To See Why People Want To Live In LaJolla!

Beautiful and breath taking!
As you walk along the edge of the promenade, you are treated to view after view, each different and each contributing to the total effect of splendid coastline beauty.
It is easy to see why so many people want to live in this fabulous community.
One word on parking. cruise the coastal drive and if nothing pops up, go inland a block or two. This is a very popular place and everyone, of course, wants to park right on the coastal drive!
Show less
Great Spot to see the Seals
Took some great pictures here. Even if you do not want to walk down to the beach, you can still get a good view of the cove and seals (and its free).
Smells horrible, but the seals were amazing!
I loved being able to go so close to the seals, they were amazing. However, the smell was terrible and I still smell it in my clothes. But this experience should be on your to do list!

One of the many great things to do near San Diego. This place is beautiful. So many scenic pictures to be taken. Scenery even has up close seal encounter if you time it tight. Nice downtown area nearby with good food and shopping options
Nice day out with the children
Coastal walks, green spaces, good restaurants and of course getting a good view of the resident seals / sea lions. Very nice place to spend the day.
This was the best part of my trip. Talk about up close with these animals! They were much more talkative and active here.
It's been in my backyard since 1974

A wonderful place. I grew-up here and played around all the time at the cove. Great snorking for the family, great scuba diving too. It's a underwater natural preserve. So come and enjoy the beauty of La Jolla Cove. One more thing- if your a surfer like I wasd this place takes north swells from Alaska. I've seen some preaty big moster waves break there.
Show less

Visited just at low tide, after the biggest high tide of the year. Wandered around the tidal pools south of the cove. Awesome! We saw an octopus, a sea hare (giant slug), crabs, anemones, etc. So much fun we spent hours there. Be careful and wear shoes with good traction. It's very slippery.
Show less

La Jolla Cove is one of the most beautiful places I have ever visited. You can walk and walk along the cove and the scenery is just breathtaking. It has a calming effect for sure. Loved seeing the sea pups and seals too. We did pay the $5 a piece to go down into the cave. We were a little disappointed that it was just an opening to see the water; we had expected to be able to walk around outside of the area a little. With that said we consider the $5 a donation to the upkeep and are still glad we got to view the ocean from this perspective. We would definitely return to this location if we ever visit San Diego again.
Show less

The ride to The Cove from San Diego is short and well worth it. Sea Lions sunning themselves in their natural habitat - you can't duplicate that in at zoo. The road is elevated but you can park for free and walk down the stairs to get pretty close. Thankfully there is a fenced barrier so nobody disturbs the creatures. You can get great photos with the animals as they position themselves on the cove beach which is shielded from the crashing waves. No matter where you are headed, you must take a little time to stop and enjoy these beautiful creatures.
Show less

A beautiful place to visit. Nice walking areas along the beaches and on the rocks. Spans for a distance the cove and park area. The best part if you are an animal and nature lover are the sea lions. You could walk right up to them with in arms distance to watch them. It was very cool to see them in this way. Of course you do not touch them or disturb them. The only downside is the parking in the area. If busier the street parking is taken up very fast. I would suggest just finding a parking ramp that is near and parking there. We drove for quite some time searching for a spot and then ended up in a parking garage anyways. Fun location.
Show less

At this time of the year it was full of seal and sea lions and their pups. The water is so blue in this area. You can walk down to a cave and look in. There are several sets of stairs that lead you to the cliffs. On another note the cliff leading up the road along the sidewalks has a significant amount of bird nests. It was great to see the birds In their natural habitat sitting on their eggs. Great place to sit and watch the ocean.
Show less
Stunningly Beautiful Ocean and Rocky Cliff to explore

We spent several hours walking the coastline, exploring the cliffs and beaches and even seeing the seals. An excellent way to spend a few hours and take it all in. It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon, so finding a place to park can be a challenge. But otherwise a beautiful picturesque day for sure. Excellent photo opportunities everywhere with beautiful rugged coastline and coved sandy beaches. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area as well.
Show less
Great views. Sea Lion Colony. Scuba Diving with Sea Lions.

This is a simple park, an expanse of grass for picnics, a beach with life guard. One the rocks around the point is a large number of sea lions and sea birds. Amazing experience.

If you scuba dive, you can swim off the beach and be surrounded by sea lions, kelp forests and other life.

Length of the visit varies wildly depending on what you're doing. Looking at sea lions? 20-30min. Swimming or diving? 1hr +.
Show less

I tagged along with my boyfriend on his business trip to San Diego recently and am so happy I went to La Jolla Cove. I took a day trip by myself here and it was just so breathtaking, I wish my boo was with me to see it. The sea lions were hangin around there too! Was neat to watch them.
Show less

Drive along the winding shores to view it all. First you’ll probably make your way up Torrey pines Blvd and notice the houses turn to shops, down Gerard st you’ll pass the best rated Thai restaurant is San Diego and it only gets better from there. Keep slowly driving and you’ll get to where people stroll on a hilltop area with exclusive boutiques and restaurants above the actual cove where the seals are viewable with a breathtaking view. There is also a great Indian place here called Taste of the Himalayas, on a slope before the water. It’s not uncommon to see people jogging, or people picnicking and taking in the view.
Show less
Beautiful beach that can get smelly

You`ll be most likely lucky to see some sealions enjoying the water by the shore, but you may not like the smell and noises they make:-))) it´s a great experience, but to me the view of the shore and sea was the best. The cave down the stairs at the little sand beach is great to take some photos at as well.
Show less
One of the best places of San Diego. Nice beaches and quiet area at least on February. My favorite place in San Diego!
The views are magnificent. It has a wonderful waterfront walk. It is sea lion pupping season. We saw so many resting on the rocks. A truly unique experience!

What a beautiful place to walk and also see lots of sea lions. A gem! You can walk along a path and bridge and look out at the water and dozens of sea lions and their babies. So beautiful, and then continue to walk along the Coast path.
Show less
Wonderful up close look at the sea lions, beautiful sunny day. Great views of the cove and the sea life around the cove. Parking was scarce but worth the effort to get their.

I was thrilled when my husband took me to La Jolla Cove, knowing nothing about it before. It's a beautiful park where you can watch birds, sea lions and seals in their natural environment. You are able to get quote close to the animals. Parking is a bit of an ordeal, but this is such an incredible spot. Next time I go, I will rent a kayak or paddle board to enjoy it from another perspective.
Show less
A must for any La Jolla visitor!
We didn't see seals at any time down the So. Cal. coast... until we hit the La Jolla Cove. And there they were! Very cool!!
Nice Spot for a Quick Stop

The cove is located near downtown La Jolla and parking is available along the waterfront. There are grassy area around the cove for the kids to run around or families to picnic. There are actually two coves to see and both had many seals and sea lions resing there on the day we visited. Some harty souls kayak or surf near the cove but swimming does not seem welcome. Depending on the weather/winds the smell from the sea mammals can be unpleasant, as it was the day we visited. This is a nice spot to stop if you are in the area for beautiful views of the ocean and the animals but not for a long visit.
Show less
Cool place to see sea lions/seals
This is a great spot to see the La Jolla Cove, the ocean views are gorgeous, good location to see the sunset and the best places to get close photos & observe the sea lions / seals!

A lovely gem within San Diego County. Just A 20-30 minute drive from downtown San Diego. Why visit Dining, shopping, sightseeing, photography, kayaking, swim with sharks. Picnic viewing the beach or dine at one of many restaurants. Some restaurants and shops are very high end but the village invites all. Parking can be a challenge near the cove but parking can always be found in the village area. A place for all occasions and ages. Some parts of the cove and village can be a challenge for those in wheel chairs and walkers but options exist. A must for short visits and all year round visitors.
Show less
Worth the stop when driving to San Diego

Beautiful view and vistas in a lovely community. Parking is difficult to find so just keep driving around. Wouldn't plan this as a beach day but you could certainly go for a swim or catch some rays on the shore for an hour or two.
This is a perfect spot to stop and watch the seals and sea lions. You can get quite close. My kids loved our visit here!
Cloudy and cool. But still great!

The weather was just coming off a little stormyish day and the surf was up! The pics don’t due it justice. It was rough and so cool to watch. Worth a trip to see and then cap it with lunch/dinner downtown. La Jolla is a gem
Show less

While they can be a bit stinky, it was pretty awesome to view the seals and sea lions basking in the afternoon sun. They are unfazed by tourists, even when some get too close in my opinion. A very unique attraction and costs nothing. Wear closed toe shoes and tread carefully.
Show less
Way to busy to be enjoyable on a Monday
So disappointed in this area. Really all of La Jolla. Just to unkempt and homeless and dirty. Won't be back. Had hoped to stay here next area.
Views and wildlife like no where else

Breathtakingly beautiful and so much fun! The cove has something for everyone — beaches to sunbathe on, benches to marvel at the views, parks to play in, and a ton of wildlife that you can get super close to! I enjoyed watching the seals at the Children’s Pool but the real treat was climbing down onto the rocks to hang out with seal lions — I can’t believe how close we were able to get to them! I felt like a kid again! What an incredible experience — I highly recommend it for all ages.
Show less
Enjoy breakfast or dinner and then take a walk and see the ocean. Surprisingly not crowded, but good enough to people watch.
Wild Life right on the beach

If you have the temperament to walk among sea lions at sunset, then you have come to the right place. The views here are fantastic at sunset and the place comes alive as humans and wildlife come together to enjoy the location. There is a great walkway along the ocean front and many great spots for taking pictures. You will not forget this place.
Show less
Parking is horrible but when you find a spot, fantastic day!!! Lots of seals, rock formations, caves, beaches....
Crowded and hard to find parking, but worth it to see the birds and seals/sea lions.
Lovely place to walk and see the wildlife. Recommend parking a few blocks inland where there are public parking lots at reasonable prices.
Don't miss the Seals and Sea Lions

This is a short drive from San Diego, and a great place to view wildlife - primarily sea birds (pelicans, cormorants, etc.), seals and sea lions. There is a nice walkway along the coast with some great views. The town is also nice, with lots of shops, places to eat, etc. Definitely plan a half or whole-day trip, if you're visiting San Diego.
Show less
Great view of ocean and sea lions
Nice area to walk and visit the many sea lions and seals lining the water edge. Cute shops. We drove, be aware, not easy to find parking and lots of traffic between 4-6PM.
Wow! An amazing way to spend a day in nature! Seals, sea caves, beautiful beaches and whales!! What more could you ask for! I loved spending time here!
Good sights and you are able to get close to sea lions and see them in their natural habitat. Beatiful sunsent and good coffee shops. Def worth it.
Come to see the sea lions

The town is beautiful. We came just to see the sea lions and they didn't disappoint. They were everywhere and very loud. You just follow the noise. Parking is difficult so it's best to go early or drive around until you get lucky.
Where sea meets land and beauty abounds
La Jolla Cove is a beautiful area of the Southern California coastline. It's a great place to see seals in their natural habitat.

We spent the day seeing several sites that only required an hour or two. This was stop number four on our list.

It took a little while to find parking somewhere relatively close.

However once we secured parking, it was a quick walk to the beach viewing area.

They have many bathroom facilities at the beach. There is an elevated horseshoe path that goes out over the water to create the cove.

Sometimes you need to time your walking just so on the elevated path or else you'll get soaked by a wave. The elevated path is a great viewing area for both looking out into the ocean and looking at the sea lions.

You could walk down a flight of steps and walk on the beach area right by the sea lions or seals. They did have a rope up to keep visitors behind so the animals could have their safety.

It was amazing seeing these creatures swim out of the ocean and belly flop on to the beach.
Show less
A perennial favorite for locals and tourists alike

As a San Diego resident and almost native, I have been coming here for decades all year round. Whether to do landscape photography, portraits, or to enjoy a pic nic with the breath taking sunsets or to snorkel and swim in the cove, or to stroll along the scenic boardwalk. La Jolla Cove offers endless attractions everyone.

On my most recent visit last weekend, we worked up an appetite walking all over and then he had a nice lunch pic-nic on the grass. Lovely!
Show less
I try to come every year. Love the sea lions. Hate that people try to get too close to them. Beautiful beaches

We swim at LJ Cove frequently. Usually swim a mile or so, to one of the buoys. On a clear water day you can see a variety of fish, turtles, sharks, bat rays and seals. Water is warm in August. Sometimes 70 degrees F.
Always feel safe with other swimmers. We never swim alone. Nice restaurants nearby after swimming. Lifeguards usually on duty.
Show less
Must see to see the seals and sea lions!

We were hesitant to visit the cove because of weekend parking, but we found a place right in front of the cove! You’re able to walk out on the rocks to get a good view. It’s a must see that you definitely shouldn’t miss if you’re anywhere near La Jolla!
Show less

Almost walked on to a sealion

It is a scenic spot with some good amount of sealions
A small sand beach accessible by stairs
I almost unknowingly walked on to a sea lion,till my wife yelled at me
A sea lion just in the color of sand was relaxing on the beach

Parking can be a pain especially during sunset times,you could park on the parallel stree where there are a lot of shops and walk down
Show less

Easy walk.. outstanding scene .. beautiful weather. If you are on scope diving you differently need to try there. Bike rental shops are every where. Food and ice cream tiny shops. Georgia Resturant is my fav as they offer international cuisine .. enjoy !

Great place to overlook the caves from above- you can walk down to the rocks or over to one of the decks. Lots of pelicans, sea lions and cormorants. There is also a rocky beach, but there are nicer beaches if that is what you looking for. Nice grassy park above cliffs. Also fun to rent kayaks and paddle out to cliffs.
Show less
Absolutely beautiful place. Great views and amazing seals which are so close to you. Will definitelly go back!

Just loved it here, stopped off for lunch & had a stroll down to the beach, it’s so beautiful & never seen so many seals & sea lions just enjoying the sun, it was amazing. You get to get right up close to them , never experienced it before & loved it. The scenery is breathtaking.
Show less

Can’t say much more. Crystal clear water, wild life everywhere, and the beautiful California coastline. Do not miss if you are in the San Diego area. It is a very easy and short drive. Much to see and do!

Beautiful beach area to see sea lions and seals up close. You might even see a whale in the distance. Tide pools and rock formations to explore. Close (walkable) to downtown shopping and restaurants. Well worth the visit!
Glad we went, locals were very friendly and proud of their neighborhood. The Cove was interesting with seals and sea lions and swimmers..good walking paths, restaurants and shops... glad we went!!

This was our first visit to La Jolla. Got a great deal on a kayaking tour through everyday California. The water was clear and calm, the wild life was plentiful. La Jolla has a lot of history and charm. Absolutely beautiful.
One of the best view beach in Southern California.

Beautify houses, beautiful flowers around the neighborhood that made this Cove very nice and worth to visit. Many restaurants around, coffee shops, bars, lunch or dinner. This place is one stop shop for tourists around the country and world.
Hard to park but a good place to see seals and pelicans. There are kayaking trips but it is exposed sea not protected coves mostly
A bucket-list item for families! Even teen boys will love it!

When I was about 19, my dad took me to San Diego and I first experienced the Cove. Coming from Indiana, it made quite an impression.
Twenty-six years later, during a week-long, jam-packed tour of California highlights in SF, LA and SD with my three teen boys, this was on my must-do list.
We were there on a late Saturday morning just before New Years, and it did take us quite a while to snag a free 2-hr parking spot right along the shore, but I’m glad I didn’t let the boys’ frustration with parking and heavy traffic deter me, as they LOVED it!! Yes, my active, hard-to-impress, video-game-addicted 13, 14 and 19 year old boys could have stood and watched seals all day long (if their stomachs hadn’t started growling) and ranked this above the Hollywood sign, Hollywood Blvd and other famous Cali spots when our week was over. Watching them re-live my own experience so long ago made me tear up and brought me such joy... that we ended up there on my birthday was perfect, because sharing the experience with them and taking in those views again were the best gifts ever.
This is one of those things you never forget- especially for older kids, I think.
Show less
Great place to see sea lions and seals. The kids loved watching them in their natural habitat. Parking was hard to come by, be prepared to walk quite a ways.

A great place to see seals and sea lions up close in their natural habitats. Along with kayakers, snorkelers, and divers. We came during low tide and it was great to see parts of the ocean floor. Gorgeous scenery. Would recommend for a peaceful and relaxing couple hours in La Jolla.
Show less

My family used to live in San Diego, and visiting La Jolla Cove is etched as a favorite memory. Although we would picnic, I strolled along the water and just took everything in. Seals, expansive views and people from all over the world. Parking was easy in off-season. Very enjoyable experience. I didn't get to the well-rated Taco Stand but just being in La Jolla again was worthwhile.
Show less

Stopped in La Jolla after a morning of hiking Torrey Pines. Walked around La Jolla, had lunch, and visited the Cove. It was really cool! I loved checking out the caves, tide pools, and seals/sea lions. Such beautiful water, landscape, & nature.

I am from Michigan and we may have the beautiful Great Lakes, but you don't get to see this rugged cliff landscape often!

Highly recommend a visit if you are in the area. Very easy drive from San Diego as well.
Show less
La Jolla is overrated but introduce yourself to the sea lions in the cove

I'm not a fan of La Jolla. It has the same upper+class atmosphere you find in Monaco and Beverly Hills. This is the place for the Armani crowd so you better bring your Bugatti and some heavy duty credit cards.

But if you like animals head straight for the Cove. Here seals and sea lions are hanging out most of the year, and I can assure you there isn't much Beverly Hills over that smell. But I love watching the sea lions and the seals sleep, snooze, swim, and fight. Don't miss it.

The coastline is beautiful, too and you can get really close to the gorgeous creatures of the sea. You can easily spend an hour here, especially if you like to take photos.
Show less
Great for viewing seals, sea lions, and ocean birds

There are nearly always both seals and sea lions along the coast here that you can see along a walking path. There are also a couple areas where you can go down to the beach areas to get closer views (but make sure you do not het too close to the sea lions, which can be aggressive). There are also dramatic views of waves crashing on the rocks.
Show less
Very nice to see Sea Lions Up close and also there are some excellent views of the Ocean. The area where sea lions are concentrated stinks a bit but its not bad if you are a bit far from that.
Wow. What a place. National Geographic live. Beautiful scenery, sunset, and animals!!!!!!!!! Loved it.

Cool to see the sea lions and seals but the smell is horrendous. Be prepared to gag. The smell was almost unbearable but did go away the closer you got to the animals, strangely enough. Don't plant to spend too much time there as you can see it all quite quickly.
Show less

This was a beautiful area to visit! The seals were in 'pupping season' so we couldn't get too close, but they were fun to watch. Clean and peaceful area. Parking was hard to find but the walk wasn't too bad.
Definitely should stop by this area for the scenery and ocean views. There are tons of shops and restaurants nearby.
Really Don't Know How to Rate It - It's Great, but...

It's really challenging to know how to rate this place. On the one hand, there's a nice walkway for exploring, a bit of sand if you want to dip into the water, some caves to explore, and a great grassy area for a bit of play or a picnic. On the other hand, there are seals and sea lions (great fun to observe, not so great to smell), plus the square footage is small so I can see it getting really crowded during summer.

It was really enjoyable to stroll around on a pleasant, sunny day - there's a lot of variety of coastal phenomenon in a small area. My biggest annoyance was observing idiots attempting to interact up close with the animals (letting your child go close enough to touch a seal that is nursing pups so you can take a picture...ugh...too bad it would be the child and not the parent who would be injured in that scenario).

Idiots aside, it's a pretty little spot (5-stars). Unfortunately, idiots are everywhere and on a sunny day there are more of them (3- or fewer stars). I'm going to split the difference and go with 4-stars and just give the warning to beware of the idiots and small number of parking spots (and the sea lion smell).
Show less

This place is beautiful. Well maintained lots to see and enjoy. Plenty of wildlife, birds and seals. Some beach access also. Just a pleasant place to to stroll, get a bite of food or coffee or just watch the seals and waves.
Beautiful view, cool animal life, but horrible odor!

We loved being in the La Jolla area, we at brunch overlooking the cove. It was fun to watch the seals/sea lions, but the smell was almost enough to go somewhere else. I don't think I'd want to stay in a hotel near there.

This cove/park was one of the most interesting places we visited. It was amazing to watch the sea lions and seals up close and personal. You can walk down onto the rocks they are sunbathing on, and although there are posted signs saying they can and will bite and/or attack, people were walking right up to the seals and taking pictures. The only drawback is the smell, and it is pretty strong.
Show less
Lovely cove with sea lions and birds .. great stroll along the beach. Unfortunately we didn’t check trip advisor when we choose the restaurant! Good view but expensive and poor food.
Favourite spot in San Diego! Come for an afternoon and walk along the beautiful coastline and visit the 1000 sea lions!

While not every restaurant in La Jolla was participating, we found plenty of places that were and had a great time. Very walkable town with lots to see and do, if you like to shop, eat, and drink! Loved all the fur Seals and sea lions on the rocks. We were able to walk right up to them and while you do need to keep your distance, it was fun to watch their interactions.
Show less
Beautiful little town about 20 min from San Diego. Very touristy and can be crowded, however worth the trip. Very walkable, nice beach areas, plenty of restaurants.
This is a wonderful coastal area to just enjoy the ocean and the community. But it is an amazing spot to see the many seals and sea lions, ocean birds and tidal pools.

This was the highlight of our trip, seeing wildlife in its natural setting was amazing. The rocks are filled with seals and amazing birds. Seals can be viewed frolicking in the surf and sum bathing on the rocks. The ocean and mountains are spectacular. There is a cabe to tour veey close on water sports. Really special location.
Show less

This is a beautiful area to walk or sit. An ocean view with plenty of sea life including boats, snorkelers and kayakers. Stroll along the cliffs and guess where the other walkers are from. If you get tired it's just a short uphill walk to bars and restaurants.
Show less

We were in San Diego for a couple of days and were told to definitely visit La Jolla Cove. Very glad we did. Reaching there is easy using train/bus from San Diego.
It's a fantastic place to spend an evening. Its very scenic and you can see the most gorgeous of sunsets.
Great place to see Sea Lions in the wild up close. Great variety of birds too. Must visit if in San Diego.
Show less

This is definitely worth stopping at if you are in La Jolla. Go early! I arrived at 9:30am on a Saturday and got one of the last spots right along the grassy park area. There weren't too many tourists either. By the time I left, it was crowded and lines of cars snaked along the road looking for a parking spot. There are so many sea lions! I stayed for a couple of hours walking along the paths. Further inland are lots of small shops for food and gifts/trinkets.
Show less

Love the views in this area. Stairs give easy access down to the cove and tide pools. At low tide you can find hermit crabs, anemones, limpets, various sea plants and get up close to the sea lions. Great experience.
Great place to take pictures of the sea lions and get up close to them. Breath taking views. Great way to spend the morning and watch a sunset.

This is a staple for every visit that I make my way out to San Diego. Sometimes you are not able to go on to the beach close to the sea lions, and other times you can (which is MUCH better obviously) - so be sure to check before planning your travels. We were lucky enough to see the birth of a baby seal once before this trip and it was so cool to see how raw and real nature can be.
Show less

Great place to see seal pups up close. They are all around and on full display for visitors! Just don't try to get too close. Some people do that, but I'd say just admire them from a distance without being too invasive. Warning, there are huge crowds in the area and traffic is horrible. We went in August.
Show less
This is a beautiful spot where you can get close to sea lions sunning themselves on the cliffs. Also lots of neat birds, many nesting on the cliffs. Well worth a stop!
Had a nice walk with the family along the stroll. My son loved looking at the seals (even though they are stinky) Such a nice way to spend an afternoon
Spend some time here and enjoy the view

We only got to spend an hour here, but would have love to stay longer. What beautiful view of the coast line with water smashing on the jagged rocks. If you love to see seals, you don't even need to go to sea world. You can walk right up to wild seals hanging around the cove. Lots of different kind of bird if you love seeing and photographing birds as well. Looks like there are some nice restaurant with a perfect view of the ocean to pair with your meals, but we ran out of time and didn't get to try it.
Show less
Beautiful landscape, very comfortable walk on the coastline. Nice view of the harbor seals during pupping season.
Gorgeous ocean views Seals are everywhere. Walk down to the beach and through the town. Cute shops! Great for children of every age. I will return and stay here next time!.
Visited La Jolla Cove with my family. It was a great experience for my 4 and 7 year old granddaughters.

On a warm winter day La Jolla Cove is a great place to walk. There are many people all watching the sea lions and seals sunbathe. It is fun for both adults and children. There are street vendors and many restaurants nearby where one can eat and look at beautiful ocean views.
Show less
La Jolla is in San Diego and is considered to be a very luxurious place to live in. Condos there have excellent Ocean Views.

A perfect spot along the coastline of San Diego. Nicely protected. Enjoy this little slice of perfection. A short walk along and you go down to a spot which overlooks the sea perfect for photos. Not to far at an area of coffee shops . Ice cream places and plenty of eating spots. La Jolla cove is the name given to this area.
Show less
This place has a perfect sunset and is great not only for local communities but also for tourist!!!!
Went early morning to avoid the crow, and it is just amazing. It is impressive how you could be so close to nature. This is a great place to just sit and relax.
Great place to see sea lions!

We were here during pup-ing season, so nobody was allowed on the beach. But we did see some swimmers. The sea lions were sunning themselves on the rocks and having a great time. Loved watching them! I've swam in the Cove before, with other triathletes and distance swimmers. It's a great place to hang out.
Show less

A beautiful place that allows you to walk around and take it all in. You can walk around the and see the sea lions right in front of you. The coast is calming and just an incredible place to relax and watch beauty all around you.
Show less

I have the opportunity to experience the wonderful company of many sea lions, just adorable all of them.. I highly recommend this attraction, just remember to keep a safe distance and don't get to close to the seal babies or cubs otherwise their parents will abandon them..
Show less

This is a great destination spot to swim in the surf, snorkel and see some seals. Had a bite of lunch overlooking the caves then explored the site, watched the seals playing and singing. It was well worth the drive even thought the weather wasn't ideal. Gorgeous spot!
Show less

A must see while in San Diego! La Jolla Cove is home to so much to see and do. There is park, put your feet in the water, or swim, plenty of shopping, eating, leisurely walking. Looking North you can see the Scripps Research Center and Pier, There are lots of seals and sea lions who love to hang out there too!
Show less

La Jolla is one of the most beautiful cities along Southern California Coast
And it’s a must visit spot
Our family just loves it , it’s one of our favorite spots
And La Jolla cove has so many adventure to offer, you can go kayaking or even just take a walk and see the seals
Show less
La Jolla has some of the best happy hours. Try Cantania, Isola, Herringbone and Ambrogio 15 for gourmet foods at affordable happy hour prices.
Visited La Jolla for a wedding. A lovely location with wonderful restaurants and stores. And, I had my first Pacific coast diving experience. A great stop for a relaxing weekend or get away.

This was a park-like setting and a very nice place to just sit and watch the ocean with the beautiful sunset. The colors were amazing. We spent several hours just watching the seals and sea lions and were able to climb the rocks down and get within several feet of them. The waves crashing on the rocks were just so amazing to hear and watch.
Show less
Great Sea Lion and Seal Watching Here!

We saw so many migrating sea lions. They were very friendly and put on quite a spontaneous show! The seals were a bit less active. The waves were very rough the days we visited and we loved watching them slam against the sea walls. What a pretty way to spend time in LaJolla!
Show less

While in SD, I recommend taking a bit of time to check out this area. We came about 10:30 am and easily found parking and enjoyed a nice stroll. The wildlife was interesting to see and it was fun watching the sealions and seals. The cove area is nice as well. There were some brave folks who were also swimming in the cove (way too cold for me). This is a nice area and certainly does not need to be a long visit, but it certainly warrants a look if you are in the area.
Show less
Great place to enjoy a great view and find some peace. Well maintained. A bit busy, but what beach isn't?
Nice place to view Sea Lions
This is an attractive part of coast line. There , at least when I was there, were plenty of opportunities to get close to to Sea Lions and other wildlife. Very enjoyable and not crowded (weekday).
Spend the Day, Enjoy the Sunset
This is a beautiful location. If you want to swing, kayak hang out, have lunch or watch the sunset, it's just a really pretty place.
Its a great place to go for a walk. The park on the border to the beach and the ocean has great views. Nice place to eat an Icecream or a bear, depending on how you feel.
What a beautiful place to grab lunch or dinner, Georgie’s if the perfect restaurant for a relaxing lunch or dinner. Great walking along the water just beautiful
This is where all the kayakers launch from. It's a nice little beach and makes for easy access for kayaking.
The sunset at La Jolla was the best I have ever seen!! With luxury houses on one end, a small pier in the centre and the city on the other!! A must visit when in San Diego!

My two grandkids and I went for breakfast in La Jolla and went to spent the day. We made a picnic lunch which you can have at the park. We saw the sea lions and took pictures as well as went in the water on the beach at the kids beach area. They also have a Cave at the Cave store that can be explored as well.
Show less
Pleasant, cozy cove with beach, kayaking, sea lions and places to eat and drink. We did a kayak tour of the caves in the cove. Safe, fun and very interesting.
We visited shortly after the sun came up and it was absolutely beautiful. Bring your camera for some amazing photo opportunities. And keep an eye out for the seals.

La Jolla Cove is one of the classic must visit places in the USA.
The seals and pelicans and sea lions own the place, but you can swim in the Cove during warmer weather. Beautiful waves, accessible to most who come. Thanks to California for not making these beaches into private property.
Show less

Worth a visit to see the seals, sea lions and birds, esp pelicans. Parking was tough but the walk along the coast is lovely. My teens enjoyed exploring the rocks too. Not really a sit and bathe Beach but definitely worth the trip.

As a native, I've seen the Cove over the years and it's still positively heaven on Earth. Great path to workout or run; great stroll for clearing your head and then enjoying the seals, especially during pupping season. Recommend going early before the tourist groups and it's stunning in the morning sun.
Show less
A fun place to spend a few hours!

We just dropped in as we were driving by and wish we'd planned a longer visit. Sea lions and seals, good food, fabulous scenery! The surf was up to about 8 feet so we enjoyed watching some very hardy (crazy?!) dudes out body surfing.
There are many things to do at La Jolla Cove including walking thru the cave to see the ocean, eating at fine restaurants and sitting on the beach.

My daughter and i could have spent the whole day there but the wind came up and we were a bit chilly. Bring a sweat shirt and your camera and then simply enjoy the day near the water and the animals. Be sure to check out the sea lions while watching for whales in the distance. Plenty of free and paid parking.
Show less
Great walk and views of the ocean and sea lions/seals

We always stop here after we eat for a nice walk. It’s a great place for a walk and to look at the sea lions and seals. We came here in January and they are always here, but whether they are at the cove or a different spot nearby just depends on the surf. Be aware that the area near the wildlife is pretty smelly. Also when they are by the cove there are stairs to climb down but don’t be the person that gets up right close and disturbs them.
Show less
Loved our visit and time in La Jolla

Our family of 4 (kids 10 & 12) thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Cove yesterday! We loved seeing the sea lions basking in the sun. And the scenery is amazing! We were very sad to see people getting way too close to the seals in order to take pics and selfies. The seals would move away as people got closer but apparently the people are either not smart enough to know they are scaring them or they simply don’t care. I sincerely hope the seals don’t stop coming to this amazing place if the people don’t stop invading their territory. Please respect these animals and stay back on the sidewalks!!
Show less
Just a relaxing, beautiful area to spend some time at. It was a bit overcast with large swells. Saw surfers, seals and pelicans.

Not sure what all the hype is about this place but my husband and I found this place to be just OK. We people watched and that's basically it, maybe it's because we went during November and it was bit chilly, it was still just ok.
Show less

Traveled to San Diego to see friends and took the kids to La Jolla Cove - they enjoyed the sea cave and the sea lions with their favorite being the steps that lead down to the ocean. Hang on to your kids since the waves can sneak up and take out any littles not hanging on to the railing tightly. Overall a fun day.
Show less
This was on my bucket list. The day was a bit windy and the water a little choppy but still wonderful.

Such a nice scenery, there are a couple of small beaches (at least from what I saw from my walk), one of them is out of reach because seals go there (such a nice surprise!). When we were there the sand was covered by seals chilling under the sun, so beautiful! There were some locals that were "catching" sea hares and showing them to the tourists. It was a stretch to find a parking spot though.
Show less
Beautiful natural area, but tourists should be kept off beach during sea lion pupping season. Tourists stress the animals in their habitat.
Beautiful natural cove easily reached with a short walk.

La Jolla cove is a beautiful natural cove that can be easily seen below without any walking or explored on foot with only a short walk. Many coves are a long hike but not his one. It is a cove that can be enjoyed from above as well as from the town of La Jolla. There are many good restaurants that offer great food, drinks and an amazing view.
Show less
This is a place that you need to visit if you go to San Diego. We went as a family. We walked around the bay and we saw the seal lions. It is a gorgeus place!
We stopped there for a morning walk, and were fortunate enough to see so many seals just hanging out and socializing with humans!

Kayaking over the kelp forest, watching a whale migration, and hearing the songs of sea lions was the ultimate experience. This place is a great way to spend the afternoon and is just 20 minutes outside of SD.

Went to sort of see the sunrise... weird I know - but my nephew said the colors in the sky were amazing so we decided to check it out.. he was right - the sunrise (although we didn't actually see the sun come up) we saw colors in the sky that looked nothing like a sunrise in Chicago. We were here the night prior and experienced a ton of seals and sea lions. They were everywhere and very vocal. There are signs up telling you to keep your distance - sea lions can be dangerous, but even just sitting on a bench close by - they are still sooo close. Besides the seals - the beach and facilities were very clean and taken care of. It was very peaceful and serene.. I would definitely go back!
Show less

Great scenic trip, especially around sunset. Go in the season where you can see seals and sea lions-I wouldn't suggest getting too close, but you can get some great photos! Explore the coves via kayak or paddle-board if you have time.
A very nice beach and area with nice houses and ok restaurants (no to the level of what you would expect there...)
What an amazing experience. There were so many seals laying around, just sun bathing, letting us watch them be lazy. We loved it!!!
Hopefully you get a sunny day while visiting here as it can be a bit foggy sometimes. Lunch on the grass or a few photos by the water is nice
